tier_2_material.accused_age: Abhijit @ Rohit Chandrakant Pawar: 22 years, Pravin @ Khanna Pavlas Waidande: 27 years
tier_2_material.motive_for_crime: Not explicitly mentioned, but possibly coercion and sexual assault

tier_3_contextual.place_of_offense: Field near Peth Bhimnagar, Taluka Walwa, District Sangli

tier_4_procedural.case_number: CRIMINAL APPEAL NO.996 OF 2017, CRIMINAL APPEAL NO.655 OF 2016
tier_4_procedural.case_title: Abhijit @ Rohit Chandrakant Pawar vs. State of Maharashtra, Pravin @ Khanna Pavlas Waidande vs. State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.appellant_or_petitioner: Abhijit @ Rohit Chandrakant Pawar, Pravin @ Khanna Pavlas Waidande
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Mr. Sachin Chavan, Ms. Nasreen Ayubi, Mrs. Megha Bajoria
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 363, 366-A, 342, 376(D), 323, 506 r/w Section 34 of IPC and Section 6 of the POCSO Act
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code, Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012

residual_details.additional_facts: The trial court convicted the appellants for several IPC offenses but acquitted them under the POCSO Act due to lack of proof of the victim's age. The victim was allegedly kidnapped while returning from a medical shop and subjected to sexual assault. The incident was reported after a delay, and the victim's age was questioned due to discrepancies in the birth certificate. The prosecution relied on the victim's testimony and medical evidence, while the defense argued lack of evidence and delay in reporting.
